intro: Onoseris salicifolia subsp. salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaved onoseris, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, willow-like leaves and produces yellow to orange disc flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical structure supports its role in ecological systems, providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
